location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No 17 of 1822 from William Bruce, Resident at Bushire to Francis Warden, Chief Secretary to the Government, Political Department, Bombay

physicalDescription.extent: Condition: The item has suffered from pest damage, which has resulted in a small hole in the fabric of the folio that slightly obscures some of the address, and the body of the letter on the verso side.

mods.abstract: The letter is enclosing a translation of a firmaun [firman] from Prince Hossain Ali Meerza [Ḥusayn ‘Alī Mirzā] regarding the property of a Persian merchant, the late Seyd Saduck seized at Calcutta. The Prince is demanding that the seized property, detailed in the letter, should be restored to its rightful owners.
